question: The Prague Spring in Czechoslovakia and the Belarus 2020 Protests both emerged in response to the same form of Soviet-style political domination.

question: Both the Irish Gaelic Revival and the Ukrainian Cultural Movement resisted centralization, but only one opposed new railway mapping as an instrument of linguistic standardization.

options.b: Somali Lineage Defenders & Hawaiian Anti-Annexation Movements

question: The Satsuma Rebellion and the Crimean Tatar uprisings both involved military reorganization disputes, but only one rejected the abolition of hereditary military stipends.

options.b: Austrian Liberal School Reform Opposition & Ottoman Craft Guild Resistance

question: Both the Persian Tobacco Protest and the Tanzanian Maji Maji Rebellion opposed foreign intrusion, but only one targeted commercial monopolies rather than agrarian coercion.

options.c: Thai Surname Edict Protesters & Ottoman Balkan Resistance

question: The Hungarian 1848 Revolution and the Egyptian Urabi movement both fought for constitutional limits on monarchy, but only one resisted foreign-funded commercial railways.

options.b: Soviet Collectivization Resistance & Tanzanian Ujamaa Village Opposition

question: Both the Ghost Dance Movement and the Egyptian 1919 Revolution emerged from spiritual-nationalist symbolism, but only one framed foreign occupation as a threat to cosmic balance.

options.b: Indian Panchayat Defenders & Ethiopian Oromo Gadaa Protesters

question: The Tupac Amaru II rebellion and the Meiji samurai uprisings both resisted intrusive tax reforms, but only one opposed a new birth-registration system meant to classify ethnic identity.

options.c: Adivasi Forest Rights Movements & Burmese Karen Anti-Logging Campaigns
